intro: Trimezia fistulosa var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved trimezia, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its narrow, strap-like leaves that can grow up to several feet in length. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with a tubular shape that attracts pollinators like bees and hummingbirds. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its elegant appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
